\chapter{boxPlot}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/boxPlot:module-boxPlot}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/boxPlot:boxplot}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/boxPlot::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!boxPlot@\spxentry{boxPlot}}\index{boxPlot@\spxentry{boxPlot}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: U64053
\index{boxPlotter() (in module boxPlot)@\spxentry{boxPlotter()}\spxextra{in module boxPlot}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/boxPlot:boxPlot.boxPlotter}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{boxPlot.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{boxPlotter}}}{\emph{df}, \emph{graphTitle}, \emph{boxCols}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
Represents a box plot from the data of a dataframe.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{df}}] \leavevmode{[}pandas DataFrame{]}
dataframe containing the data to plot.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{graphTitle}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
title of the plot, used as fileName if not provided.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{boxCols}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings{]}
Columns of df to plot in the boxplots.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}matplotlib figure object.{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{tickLabels}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings, optional{]}
Labels for the box plot, must have the same lenght as boxCols. 
If not provided, boxCols is used.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{colors}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings, optional{]}
Colors to color the boxplos, must have the same lenght as boxCols. 
If not provided the default palette is used.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
Label for the x axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
Label for the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{showMeans}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default is True{]}
Show mean marker.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{showFliers}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default is True{]}
Show fliers markers.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{notch}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False{]}
Activate notched boxes.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default is 10.{]}
X dimension of the figure in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ySize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default is 6.{]}
Y dimension of the figure in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yLim}}] \leavevmode{[}list of floats (min, max), optional{]}
It is used to set y axis limits.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{cappkw}}] \leavevmode{[}dict, optional, \{“color”: “k”\}{]}
Specifies the style of the caps.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{boxeskw}}] \leavevmode{[}dict, optional, default is \{“color”:”k”\}{]}
Specifies the style of the box.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{whiskerskw}}] \leavevmode{[}dict, optional, default is \{“color”:”k”\}{]}
Specifies the style of the whiskers.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{flierskw}}] \leavevmode{[}dict, optional{]}
Specifies the style of the fliers. 
The default is \{“marker”:’.’, “markeredgecolor”:”k”\}.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{medianskw}}] \leavevmode{[}dict, optional, default \{“color”:”k”\}{]}
Specifies the style of the median.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{meankw}}] \leavevmode{[}dict, optional{]}
Specifies the style of the mean. 
The default is \{“marker”:”o”, 
“markerfacecolor”:”lightgrey”, 
“markeredgecolor”:”k”, “markersize”:”5”\}.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette, default “deep”{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list 
interpretable as a palette by seaborn.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
File name to save, if not provided graphTitle will be used. 
Non alphanumeric values will be deleted.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Examples}

\chapter{enhancedTable}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/enhancedTable:module-enhancedTable}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/enhancedTable:enhancedtable}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/enhancedTable::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!enhancedTable@\spxentry{enhancedTable}}\index{enhancedTable@\spxentry{enhancedTable}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{enhancedTable() (in module enhancedTable)@\spxentry{enhancedTable()}\spxextra{in module enhancedTable}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/enhancedTable:enhancedTable.enhancedTable}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{enhancedTable.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{enhancedTable}}}{\emph{df}, \emph{fileName}, \emph{rowLabelCol}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
Represent a table or several tables. 
Options to add a total row, header, labels…
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{df}}] \leavevmode{[}pandas Dataframe{]}
Dataframe containing the data.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Filename to use to save the table, 
non alphanumeric characters will be removed.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{rowLabelcol}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Name of the dataframe column of df to use as label values.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}matplotlib figure object.{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{labelStyle}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “label”,{]}
Style of the labels, “label” or “column”.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{totalRow}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False{]}
If true add a new row with the total per colum.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{header}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default False{]}
If it has a value add a header cell with that value.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{tableNum}}] \leavevmode{[}integer, optional, default 1.{]}
Number of tables to split the data in.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{layout}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “vertical”{]}
Layout to place the tables relative to each others, can be
‘horizontal’ or ‘vertical’.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fontSize}}] \leavevmode{[}integer, optional, default False.{]}
Size of the font, if False, 
let the code decide the best horizontal fit.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 18{]}
Max horizontal size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ySize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 8.{]}
Max vertical size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{rowLabelColor}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “grey”{]}
Color to use for the labels, named colors or HEX values.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{colLabelColor}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “grey”{]}
Color to use for the labels, named colors or HEX values.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{minimalistic}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False.{]}
If true, most of the cell lines are hidden.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn palette or compatible, optional.{]}
Seaborn compatible palette, 
can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list interpretable 
as a palette by seaborn.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Examples}

\chapter{horizontalBarPlot}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/horizontalBarPlot:module-horizontalBarPlot}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/horizontalBarPlot:horizontalbarplot}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/horizontalBarPlot::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!horizontalBarPlot@\spxentry{horizontalBarPlot}}\index{horizontalBarPlot@\spxentry{horizontalBarPlot}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{hBarPlot() (in module horizontalBarPlot)@\spxentry{hBarPlot()}\spxextra{in module horizontalBarPlot}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/horizontalBarPlot:horizontalBarPlot.hBarPlot}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{horizontalBarPlot.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{hBarPlot}}}{\emph{df}, \emph{yCol}, \emph{xCols}, \emph{xLabel}, \emph{graphTitle}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
Represents a horizontal bar graph with vertical lines, 
anotations and text under the graph.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{df}}] \leavevmode{[}pandas dataframe{]}
Dataframe with the data to represent.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
df column name to represent in the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xCols}}] \leavevmode{[}string or list of strings{]}
df column or column names 
to represent in the x axis. If multiple columns are used,
stacked bars will be used.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
label for the x axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{graphTitle}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Title of the graph, will be used as file name if not provided.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}matplotlib figure object.{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{colorCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default False{]}
df col to use as label to choose color. 
If False all bars are colored equally.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{colorDict}}] \leavevmode{[}list of dictionaries, default False{]}
List with as many elements as xCols
with dicts with colorCol label:color to use to color the bars.
Example: {[}\{“S1”: “g”, “S2”: “r”\}, \{“S1”: “b”,”S2”: “orange”\}{]}

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xLim}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default False{]}
Limit of the x axis in x data units.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{nLim}}] \leavevmode{[}integer, optional, default False.{]}
Limit of the number of elemnents of yCol 
displayed in the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ascending}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False.{]}
False for higher values, True of lower values.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{vLabels}}] \leavevmode{[}list of lists{]}
List of lists with annotations parameters in the format:
{[}{[}x1, y1, text1, color1, style1{]} , 
{[}x2, y2, text2, color2, style2{]} , …{]}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
x : float, x in data units where the vertical line is.

\item {} 
y : integer, y bar position to place the annotation.

\item {} 
text : string, text to display in the annotation.

\item {} 
color : string, rgb color for the line and annotation.

\item {} 
style : string, (“regular”, “highlighted”, “dashed”, “regularD”).

\end{itemize}

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional.{]}
Label for the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 12{]}
Width of the figure in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ySize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 9{]}
Height in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fontScale}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 1{]}
Factor scale for the text.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xTicksNum}}] \leavevmode{[}integer, optional.{]}
Number of x axis ticks.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette, optional{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list interpretable 
as a palette by seaborn.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
If not provided graphTitle will be used. 
Non alphanumeric values will be deleted.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{orderCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default false.{]}
Column to use to order the df. 
If false use the first element of xCols

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yElems}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings, optional{]}
List with the elements of the ycol you wish to represent.
If not provided, all elements are represented. 
It is not recomended to use it with the kw nLim.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{subText}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional.{]}
If not False, add text to the bottom of the graph.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Examples}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\chapter{metricsEvolution}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/metricsEvolution:module-metricsEvolution}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/metricsEvolution:metricsevolution}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/metricsEvolution::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!metricsEvolution@\spxentry{metricsEvolution}}\index{metricsEvolution@\spxentry{metricsEvolution}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{metricEvolutionGraph() (in module metricsEvolution)@\spxentry{metricEvolutionGraph()}\spxextra{in module metricsEvolution}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/metricsEvolution:metricsEvolution.metricEvolutionGraph}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{metricsEvolution.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{metricEvolutionGraph}}}{\emph{data}, \emph{graphTitle}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
Represents a metric evolution graph to show the progress of 
multiple elements colored by a label value. 
Elements don’t need to have the same number of points.
Can represent one line (design reference line) 
and a horizontal line (clearance line).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{data}}] \leavevmode{[}list of list,{]}
list of lists, each list containing 3 elements, 
list with the x, y, and label. For example 
{[}{[}{[}x1, x2, x3{]}, {[}y1, y2, y3{]}, label1{]}, 
{[}{[}x1, x2, x3{]}, {[}y1, y2, y3{]}, label2{]}, …{]} 
Label values will be used to choose a color for the lines.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{graphTitle}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Title of the graph, will be used as filename 
if fileName kwarg is not provided

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}matplotlib figure object.{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fontScale}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 1.{]}
Global scalation factor for every text of the figure.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{legendLoc}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “best”.{]}
Legend location, accepts standart legend locations 
for matplotlib, plus “out top right”, “out center right”, 
“out lower right” for placing the legend out of 
the plotting area and “none” for hidding the legend.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 12{]}
Horizontal size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ySize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 8{]}
Vertical size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{gridMinor}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default True.{]}
If True, minor grid is displayed.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional.{]}
Label for the x axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional.{]}
Label for the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xLim}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional.{]}
Right limit of the x axis in x data units.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yLim}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional{]}
Top limit of the y axis in y data units.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{designLine}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, default False.{]}
If True, the design reference line is represented.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{designSlope}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 1{]}
Slope for the design line.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{designIntercept}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional,default 0.{]}
Intercept for the design line.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{designColor}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default black.{]}
Named color or hex code for the design reference line.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{designLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
Label of the design reference line, it will 
be displayed in the legend.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{clearanceLine}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False{]}
If True, the clearance line is represented.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{clearancey}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 0{]}
Location in y units for the horizontal line

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{clearanceColor}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default r{]}
Named color or hex code for the clearance horizontal line.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{clearanceLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
Label of the clearance line, it will 
be displayed in the legend.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette, optional{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list interpretable 
as a palette by seaborn.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{colorDict}}] \leavevmode{[}dictionaries label: color, optional{]}
Dict with label:color to use to color the progression lines,
if not provided, the palette will be used.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional.{]}
If not provided graphTitle will be used. 
Non alphanumeric values will be deleted.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{markerShape}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “o”{]}
Shape of the marker. Check matplotlib.markers for the possible values.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{markerFill}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “w”{]}
Color to fill the marker, named color or hex code, 
use “none” for empty circles and
None to fill the circles with the color of the edges.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{markerSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 5{]}
Size of the markers.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{markerEdgeWidth}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional,  default 2{]}
Linewidth ot the edges of the markers.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\chapter{ocurrencePieChart}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/ocurrencePieChart:module-ocurrencePieChart}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/ocurrencePieChart:ocurrencepiechart}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/ocurrencePieChart::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!ocurrencePieChart@\spxentry{ocurrencePieChart}}\index{ocurrencePieChart@\spxentry{ocurrencePieChart}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{ocurrPieChart() (in module ocurrencePieChart)@\spxentry{ocurrPieChart()}\spxextra{in module ocurrencePieChart}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/ocurrencePieChart:ocurrencePieChart.ocurrPieChart}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ocurrencePieChart.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ocurrPieChart}}}{\emph{df}, \emph{countCol}, \emph{graphTitle}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
Generates a pie chart according to 
the occurence of values in a column of a dataframe.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{df}}] \leavevmode{[}pandas dataframe{]}
Dataframe containing the data.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{countCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Column of the df to count the ocurrence of the values.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{graphTitle}}] \leavevmode{[}string,{]}
title of the graph and name of the file 
if fileName is not provided.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}matplotlib figure object.{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{sufix}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
sufix to the labels

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 8,{]}
max horizontal size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ySize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 8,{]}
max vertical size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fontScale}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 1,{]}
global font scalation factor for every text of the figure.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{linewidth}}] \leavevmode{[}float, default 0,{]}
Contour line width for the pie slices 
in pixels, if 0 no line is displayed.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{linecolor}}] \leavevmode{[}strings, optional, default “k”,{]}
Colors to use for the contour lines to use, 
hex value or named color.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{shadow}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False{]}
If True, shadows are displayed for the pie.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{explode}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 0,{]}
exploding factor for the pie chart, it separates the pie slices.
If 0, no explosion is performed.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{footnote}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
footnote text to display

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{foonoteSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optionial, default 18.{]}
Font size of the footnote.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{footnoteColor}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “grey”{]}
colors the text of the footnote, hex value or named color.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{footnoteStyle}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “italic”{]}
style for the footnote, 
valid values: ‘normal’, ‘italic’, ‘oblique’.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette, optional{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list interpretable 
as a palette by seaborn.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
if not provided graphHeader will be used. 
Non alphanumeric values will be deleted.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\PYG{g+gp}{... }              \PYG{n}{footnoteStyle}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{italic}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }              \PYG{n}{fileName}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ocurr Pie Chart example}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }              \PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{ocurrTable}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/ocurrTable:module-ocurrTable}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/ocurrTable:ocurrtable}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/ocurrTable::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!ocurrTable@\spxentry{ocurrTable}}\index{ocurrTable@\spxentry{ocurrTable}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{ocurrenceTable() (in module ocurrTable)@\spxentry{ocurrenceTable()}\spxextra{in module ocurrTable}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/ocurrTable:ocurrTable.ocurrenceTable}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ocurrTable.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ocurrenceTable}}}{\emph{df}, \emph{groupColumns}, \emph{countColumn}, \emph{fileName}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
Represents ocurrence and prints a grouped table 
from a python dataframe.

It Aggregates the diferent values of 
the Dataframes groupColumns to count occurrence in countColumn.

It allows to add totals by column or row.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{df}}] \leavevmode{[}pandas dataframe{]}
Dataframe containing the data.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{groupColumns}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings{]}
df columns names to display as grouped columns.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{countColumn}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
df column name to count ocurrence.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
filename to use to save the table, 
non alphanumeric characters will be removed.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}matplotlib figure object.{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{colColor}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “grey”{]}
Colors of the header row, hex value or named color.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fontSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional,{]}
Font size of the table

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 8,{]}
max horizontal size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ySize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 8,{]}
max vertical size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{rowColoring}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default True{]}
if True the cells are colored following the palette provided.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{totalRow}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False,{]}
if True a “total per row” column will be generated.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{totalCol}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False,{]}
if True a “total per column” row will be generated.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{footnote}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
footnote text to display

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{footnoteStyle}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “italic”{]}
style for the footnote, 
valid values: ‘normal’, ‘italic’, ‘oblique’.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{footnoteColor}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “grey”{]}
colors the text of the footnote, hex value or named color.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette, optional{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list interpretable 
as a palette by seaborn.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\PYG{g+gp}{... }                \PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{polarPlot}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/polarPlot:module-polarPlot}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/polarPlot:polarplot}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/polarPlot::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!polarPlot@\spxentry{polarPlot}}\index{polarPlot@\spxentry{polarPlot}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{polarBarPlot() (in module polarPlot)@\spxentry{polarBarPlot()}\spxextra{in module polarPlot}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/polarPlot:polarPlot.polarBarPlot}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{polarPlot.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{polarBarPlot}}}{\emph{data}, \emph{labelCol}, \emph{valueCol}, \emph{colorCol}, \emph{graphTitle}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
It represents a polar bar plot with radial labels 
and title in the center.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{data}}] \leavevmode{[}pandas dataframe{]}
Dataframe containing the data.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{labelCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Name of the dataframe column containing the texts of the labels.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{valueCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Name of the dataframe column containing the data.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{colorCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string,{]}
Name of the dataframe column 
containing the labels to use to color code the bars.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{graphTitle}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Title to place in the center of the graph.
If no fileName is provided, it is used to name the file.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}matplotlib figure object.{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{sort}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default True{]}
If true, order the dataframe in valueCol order.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 8{]}
max horizontal size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ySize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 8.{]}
max vertical size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{barColors}}] \leavevmode{[}dict, optional, default False.{]}
Dict with label:color with label as colorCol column values 
and values as colors in hex values. 
If false the current palette is used.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{clearance}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional{]}
In data units, clearance of the data. 
Used to represend behind bars with alpha.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{referLine}}] \leavevmode{[}list of floats, optional{]}
References lines in fraction of max data units 
or fraction of clearance if clearance is provided.
Example:{[}0.25, 0.5, 0.75{]}

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette, optional{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list interpretable 
as a palette by seaborn.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
if not provided graphTitle will be used. 
Non alphanumeric values will be deleted.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\chapter{progressPlot}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/progressPlot:module-progressPlot}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/progressPlot:progressplot}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/progressPlot::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!progressPlot@\spxentry{progressPlot}}\index{progressPlot@\spxentry{progressPlot}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{progressPlot() (in module progressPlot)@\spxentry{progressPlot()}\spxextra{in module progressPlot}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/progressPlot:progressPlot.progressPlot}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{progressPlot.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{progressPlot}}}{\emph{df}, \emph{xCol}, \emph{yCols}, \emph{graphTitle}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
Plot progression lines from the data of a dataframe. 
To represent multiple columns as dependant variables 
and one column as independant variable. 
Allows to cumulate values, represent horizontal lines and
a design reference line.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{df}}] \leavevmode{[}pandas dataframe{]}
Datafrane with the data to represent.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
df column name to represent in the x axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yCols}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings{]}
df columns names to represent in the x axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{graphTitle}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Title of the graph.
If no fileName is provided, it is used to name the file.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}matplotlib figure object.{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{cumulative}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False{]}
If True cumulate the input dataframe.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
Label for the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
Label for the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{legendLoc}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “best”{]}
Legend location, accepts standart legend locations 
for matplotlib, plus “out top right”,”out center right”, 
“out lower right” for placing the legend out of 
the plotting area and “none” for hidding the legend.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yLim}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional{]}
Limit of the y axis in y data units.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xLim}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional{]}
Limit of the x axis in x data units.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional default 10{]}
Width of the figure in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ySize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 6{]}
Height in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fontScale}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 1.2{]}
Scale factor for the font size.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xTicksNum}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optinal{]}
Number of ticks in the x axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yTicksNum}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional,{]}
Number of ticks in the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{hLines}}] \leavevmode{[}list of lists, optional{]}
Used to display horizontal lines, one list for each line.
Each list containing a 3 or 4 elements list for each line:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
first, the y cordinate for the horizontal line,

\item {} 
second, the color for the horizontal line,

\item {} 
third, linestyle for the line, i.e. “\sphinxhyphen{}“, “\textendash{}”, “\sphinxhyphen{}.\sphinxhyphen{}“

\item {} 
fourth, label value to display in the legend (optional)

\end{itemize}

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{gridMinor}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default True{]}
If True, minor grid is displayed.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{designLine}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False{]}
If True, the design reference line is represented.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{designSlope}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 1{]}
Slope for the design line.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{designIntercept}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 0{]}
Intercept for the design line.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{designColor}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “k”,{]}
named color or hex code for the 
design reference line.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{designLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
Label for the design reference line, 
it will be displayed in the legend.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{markerShape}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “o”{]}
Shape of the marker. 
Check matplotlib.markers for the possible values.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{markerFill}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “w”,{]}
color to fill the marker, 
named color or hex code, use “none” for transparent circles and
None to fill the circles with the color of the edges.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{markerSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 5{]}
Size of the markers.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{markerEdgeWidth}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 2{]}
linewidth ot the edges of the markers.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette,{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list 
interpretable as a palette by seaborn.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
If not provided graphTitle will be used. 
Non alphanumeric values will be deleted.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\PYG{g+gp}{... }           \PYG{n}{designColor}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{b}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }           \PYG{n}{designLabel}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Design}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{g+gp}{... }           \PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{radarArray}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/radarArray:module-radarArray}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/radarArray:radararray}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/radarArray::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!radarArray@\spxentry{radarArray}}\index{radarArray@\spxentry{radarArray}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{radarArrayGraph() (in module radarArray)@\spxentry{radarArrayGraph()}\spxextra{in module radarArray}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/radarArray:radarArray.radarArrayGraph}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{radarArray.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{radarArrayGraph}}}{\emph{df}, \emph{titleCol}, \emph{radiusCol}, \emph{graphHeader}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
It represents an array of radarGraphs, 
with the possibility to use custom axes for each variable. 
Can represent a reference value and deviation form reference.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{df}}] \leavevmode{[}pandas dataframe{]}
Dataframe containing the data.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{titleCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string,{]}
Dataframe column header containing 
the elements of the graph, 
one plot will be made for each element in this column 
and the value of this colum will be used as title.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{radiusCol}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings,{]}
variables to represent in the radius of the plots.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{graphHeader: string}}] \leavevmode
Header to display for the graph, 
will be used for naming the saved file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}matplotlib figure object.{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{numPlotCols}}] \leavevmode{[}int, optional{]}
For the array of plots, number of columns. 
If not provided a layout as squared as posible will be used.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{radTicksNum}}] \leavevmode{[}int, optional, default 4{]}
Number of circular grid lines.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 12{]}
Max horizontal size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ySize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 12{]}
max vertical size of the figure, in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{multiScale}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False.{]}
If True, activates multiple escale mode 
for the radial axis of the plots.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{radLim}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional,{]}
if \sphinxtitleref{multiScale} is False, maxiumun value for the radial axes.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{radiusMax}}] \leavevmode{[}list of floats, optional{]}
if \sphinxtitleref{multiScale} is True, maximun value for each 
of the axes, use the order defined in \sphinxtitleref{radiusCol}.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fontScale}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 1{]}
global scalation factor for every text of the figure.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{radTextSize}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “large”{]}
relative font size of the labels of the axes. 
Valid values are  ‘xx\sphinxhyphen{}small’, ‘x\sphinxhyphen{}small’, ‘small’, 
‘medium’, ‘large’, ‘x\sphinxhyphen{}large’, ‘xx\sphinxhyphen{}large’

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{scaleTextSize}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “small”{]}
relative font size of the labels of the plot grid. 
Valid values are  ‘xx\sphinxhyphen{}small’, ‘x\sphinxhyphen{}small’, ‘small’, 
‘medium’, ‘large’, ‘x\sphinxhyphen{}large’, ‘xx\sphinxhyphen{}large’

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{titleTextSize}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “large”,{]}
Relative font size of the title of each plot. 
Valid values are  ‘xx\sphinxhyphen{}small’, ‘x\sphinxhyphen{}small’, ‘small’, 
‘medium’, ‘large’, ‘x\sphinxhyphen{}large’, ‘xx\sphinxhyphen{}large’

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{headerTextSize}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “x\sphinxhyphen{}large”{]}
relative font size of the header of the figure. 
Valid values are  ‘xx\sphinxhyphen{}small’, ‘x\sphinxhyphen{}small’, ‘small’, 
‘medium’, ‘large’, ‘x\sphinxhyphen{}large’, ‘xx\sphinxhyphen{}large’

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{headerVerPad}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 0.08{]}
vertical padding for the header of the figure.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{color}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default False,{]}
if false chooses the first color of the current palette.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{reference}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings, optional, default False,{]}
if not false, value in the dataframe in 
the col titleCol to use as a reference, 
this register will be used as a reference 
and not represented as a separated plot.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{referCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
Header of the col of the dataframe 
to use as key to add references. 
If not provided, all the itemps in \sphinxtitleref{reference} are allways displayed.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{referColor}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings, optional,{]}
Colors to use to represent reference values. 
Must have more elements than reference.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{devTable}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default False{]}
If true, a table with de deviation 
from the reference is displayed.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{legTitle}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “Ref. Deviation”{]}
text to display as the title of the deviation table.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette,{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list 
interpretable as a palette by seaborn.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
File name to save, if not provided graphHeader will be used. 
Non alphanumeric values will be deleted.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\chapter{scatterPlotMatrix}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/scatterPlotMatrix:module-scatterPlotMatrix}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/scatterPlotMatrix:scatterplotmatrix}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/scatterPlotMatrix::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!scatterPlotMatrix@\spxentry{scatterPlotMatrix}}\index{scatterPlotMatrix@\spxentry{scatterPlotMatrix}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{scatterMatrix() (in module scatterPlotMatrix)@\spxentry{scatterMatrix()}\spxextra{in module scatterPlotMatrix}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/scatterPlotMatrix:scatterPlotMatrix.scatterMatrix}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{scatterPlotMatrix.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{scatterMatrix}}}{\emph{df}, \emph{graphTitle}, \emph{groupCol}, \emph{correCols=None}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
Function to represent a scatter matrix with hist or kde in the diagonal
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{df}}] \leavevmode{[}pandas dataframe{]}
Dataframe to plot.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{graphTitle}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Title for the plot, used as filename.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{groupCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Name of the df column to use to separate the df in groups.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{correCols}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings, optional{]}
List of the df columns to plot, 
if None all columns except groupCol are used.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn PairGrid object{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{colors}}] \leavevmode{[}Dict\{label:color\}, optional{]}
If provided, labels of the groupCol column and the color to use. 
The default is False.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{markers}}] \leavevmode{[}string or list of strings, optional{]}
markers to use for the different groups, 
use the same if only a marker is provided.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{diagKind}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “hist”{]}
Values: “hist”, “kde” or “auto” the plot to use for the diagonal.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fontScale}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 1.2{]}
Scale factor for the font size.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette, default “deep”{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list 
interpretable as a palette by seaborn.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
File name to save, if not provided graphTitle will be used. 
Non alphanumeric values will be deleted.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{\{plot, diag, grid\}\_kwsdicts}}] \leavevmode{[}dicts, optional{]}
Dictionaries of keyword arguments. 
plot\_kws are passed to the bivariate plotting function, 
diag\_kws are passed to the diagonal plotting function, 
and grid\_kws are passed to the PairGrid constructor

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\chapter{scattHist}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/scattHist:module-scattHist}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/scattHist:scatthist}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/scattHist::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!scattHist@\spxentry{scattHist}}\index{scattHist@\spxentry{scattHist}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{scatterHist() (in module scattHist)@\spxentry{scatterHist()}\spxextra{in module scattHist}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/scattHist:scattHist.scatterHist}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{scattHist.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{scatterHist}}}{\emph{df}, \emph{xCol}, \emph{yCol}, \emph{graphTitle}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
Represents a center scatter plot of the kind “hex”, “scatter” or “kde”,
and a top and right (border) histogram plots.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{df}}] \leavevmode{[}pandas dataframe{]}
Dataframe with the data to represent.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
df column name to represent in the x axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
df column name to represent in the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{graphTitle}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
title of the graph and filename for saving.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn JoinGrid object.{]}
object that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{cKind}}] \leavevmode{[}string, \{“hex”, “kde”, “scatter”\}, optional, default “scatter”{]}
Kind of plot to use for the center plot. 
The options are “hex” for a hexagonal grid plot, 
“kde” for a kernel density estimate plot (or level surfaces) 
and “scatter” for the typical scatter plot.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
Label for the x axis. If not provided xCol is used.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
Label for the y axis. If not provided yCol is used.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{size}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 7{]}
Size of the figure in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{centerPropor}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 5{]}
Relative size of the center to the margins.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{plotSeparation}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 0.1{]}
Separation between the border plots and the center plot.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{cColor}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
hex value or named color to use in the center plot.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{cKdeFill}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default True{]}
If true it fills the center plot kde surfaces, 
if False, draw only the borders. Only if cKind is “kde”

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{cHexGrid}}] \leavevmode{[}integer, optional, default 20.{]}
Number of hexagonal grids along a axis for the center plot.
Only if cKind is “hex”.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{cHexGridColor}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “w”{]}
hex value or named color to use in the center plot 
for the hex grid borders. Only if cKind is “hex”

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{bColor}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
hex value or named color to use in the border plots.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{bBins}}] \leavevmode{[}integer, optional, default 20{]}
Number of bins (columns) of the border plots.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{bRug}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default True{]}
It switches on and off the rug representation in the border plot.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{bKde}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default True{]}
It switches on and off the kde line representation in the border plots.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{bHist}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional, default True{]}
It switches on and off the histogram representation in the border plots.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette, optional{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list interpretable 
as a palette by seaborn.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
If not provided graphTitle will be used. 
Non alphanumeric values will be deleted.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\chapter{stackedBars}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/stackedBars:module-stackedBars}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/stackedBars:stackedbars}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/stackedBars::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!stackedBars@\spxentry{stackedBars}}\index{stackedBars@\spxentry{stackedBars}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{stackedbars() (in module stackedBars)@\spxentry{stackedbars()}\spxextra{in module stackedBars}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/stackedBars:stackedBars.stackedbars}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{stackedBars.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{stackedbars}}}{\emph{dflist}, \emph{repreCols}, \emph{groupCol}, \emph{graphTitle}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
Function to represent stacked bar graph normaliced to 100\%. 
Data from multiple datasets with the same columns.
A column will be used to aggregate the rows in multiple groups.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{dflist}}] \leavevmode{[}list of pandas DataFrames{]}
list of dataframes containing the data, must all have the same columns.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{repreCols}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings{]}
list of string with the dataframe columns to represent.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{groupCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
column of the dataframe to use

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{graphTitle}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
title of the graph and filename for saving.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}matplotlib figure object.{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional.{]}
label for the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yTicksNum}}] \leavevmode{[}integer, optional{]}
Number of ticks in the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{width}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional.{]}
width betwwen 0 and 1 of the bars.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{colorDict}}] \leavevmode{[}dict, optional.{]}
dictionary with label:color being labels, 
groupCol column elements.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{legendLoc}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “best”{]}
Legend location, accepts standart legend locations 
for matplotlib, plus “out top right”,”out center right”, 
“out lower right” for placing the legend out of 
the plotting area and “none” for hidding the legend.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{inverse\_order}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional.{]}
inverse the order of the bars.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional.{]}
x size of the figure in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ySize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional.{]}
y size of the figure in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette,{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list 
interpretable as a palette by seaborn.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
File name to save, if not provided graphHeader will be used. 
Non alphanumeric values will be deleted.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\chapter{standartColorPalette}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/standartColorPalette:module-standartColorPalette}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/standartColorPalette:standartcolorpalette}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/standartColorPalette::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!standartColorPalette@\spxentry{standartColorPalette}}\index{standartColorPalette@\spxentry{standartColorPalette}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{stdColor() (in module standartColorPalette)@\spxentry{stdColor()}\spxextra{in module standartColorPalette}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/standartColorPalette:standartColorPalette.stdColor}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{standartColorPalette.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{stdColor}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{colorCod}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{series}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{color}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{reverse}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
Function to generate a color or color palette 
from the standart TEASP color database 
using the color code chosen.

If a color and a series is selected the color code is given. 
If only a series is selected, 
all the colors in that serie are given in order: 
{[}“INDIGO”, “ORANGE”, “GREEN”, “RED”, “PURPLE”, “TEAL”, “PINK”,
“GRAY”, “YELLOW”, “BLUE”{]}

If only a color is selected, a monocrome palette is given, 
from light to dark.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{colorCod}}] \leavevmode{[}string.{]}
Color code to use, valid inputs “hex”,”dec”,”rgb”.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{series}}] \leavevmode{[}integer, optional.{]}
from lighter to darker, color brightness. 
Valid inputs: {[}100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900{]}

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{color}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional.{]}
Name of the color to select. 
Valid values {[}“INDIGO”, “ORANGE”, “GREEN”, “RED”, 
“PURPLE”, “TEAL”, “PINK”, “GRAY”, “YELLOW”, “BLUE”{]}

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{reverse}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional.{]}
If True reverse the order of the color palette.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{colorOut}}] \leavevmode{[}string or list of strings.{]}
Color or list with the colors in the desired format.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Examples}

Create a list of hex or RGB values of the color series 500:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{listHex} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{stdColor}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{hex}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{series}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{500}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{reverse}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{False}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{listRGB} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{stdColor}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{rgb}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{series}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{500}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{reverse}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{False}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Create a list of decimal values of shades of Blue:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{stdColor}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{dec}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{color}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{BLUE}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{reverse}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{False}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Obtain the RGB color code of the Blue of the series 500:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{blueRGB} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{stdColor}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{rgb}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{color}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{BLUE}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{series}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{500}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}



\chapter{verticalBarPlot}
\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/verticalBarPlot:module-verticalBarPlot}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/verticalBarPlot:verticalbarplot}}\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/verticalBarPlot::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!verticalBarPlot@\spxentry{verticalBarPlot}}\index{verticalBarPlot@\spxentry{verticalBarPlot}!module@\spxentry{module}}
@author: u64053
\index{vBarPlot() (in module verticalBarPlot)@\spxentry{vBarPlot()}\spxextra{in module verticalBarPlot}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{rstFiles/verticalBarPlot:verticalBarPlot.vBarPlot}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{verticalBarPlot.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{vBarPlot}}}{\emph{df}, \emph{xCol}, \emph{barCols}, \emph{yLabel}, \emph{graphTitle}, \emph{save=True}, \emph{\textbackslash{}*\textbackslash{}*kwargs}}{}
It represents a vertical appilated bar graph with legend,
and a table at the bottom
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{df}}] \leavevmode{[}pandas dataframe{]}
Dataframe with the data to represent.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xCol}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
df column name to represent in the x axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{barCols}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings{]}
df columns names to represent in the y axis as bars.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yLabel}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Label for the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{graphTitle}}] \leavevmode{[}string{]}
Title of the graph. 
Will be used as a filename if fileName is not provided.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{save}}] \leavevmode{[}boolean, optional{]}
If True, the figure is saved into a file.

\end{description}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fig}}] \leavevmode{[}matplotlib figure object.{]}
figure that stores the generated graph.

\end{description}

\item[{Other Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{legendLoc}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “best”.{]}
Legend location, accepts standart legend locations 
for matplotlib, plus “out top right”,”out center right”, 
“out lower right” for placing the legend out of 
the plotting area and “none” for hidding the legend.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yLim}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional{]}
Limit of the y axis in y data units.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{tableCols}}] \leavevmode{[}list of strings, optional, default False,{]}
List of df cols headers to use as rows 
in the table under the plot. 
If not provided, the table will not be generated

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{tableEdge}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional, default “open”,{]}
Border style for the table 
valid values are: ‘open’, ‘closed’, ‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{width}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional{]}
Width of the bars between 0 and 1.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{xSize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional default 10{]}
Width of the figure in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{ySize}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 6{]}
Height in inches.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fontScale}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional, default 1.2{]}
Global scale factor for the font size.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{yTicksNum}}] \leavevmode{[}float, optional{]}
Number of ticks in the y axis.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{orderBy}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
\sphinxtitleref{df} column header name to use 
to order x axis in ascending order.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{hLines}}] \leavevmode{[}list of lists, optional{]}
Used to display horizontal lines, 
each list containing a 3 elements, one list for each line:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
first, the y cordinate for the horizontal line

\item {} 
second, the color for the horizontal line

\item {} 
third, linestyle to use for the line

\item {} 
fourth, label of the line, to use in the legend (optional)

\end{itemize}

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{palette}}] \leavevmode{[}seaborn compatible palette,{]}
Can be the name of a seaborn palette, 
a seaborn palette or a list 
interpretable as a palette by seaborn.

\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{fileName}}] \leavevmode{[}string, optional{]}
File name to save, if not provided graphTitle will be used. 
Non alphanumeric values will be deleted.

\end{description}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\subsubsection*{Examples}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
